name: HD 175167
scenarioDescription:
The HD 175167 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 175167 is a star with 1.37 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.75 times its radius. It is located 232.32 light years away from the solar system.

HD 175167 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 175167 system


HD 175167 b

HD 175167 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 175167 b is 2852.46 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 175167 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 175167, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Las Campanas Observatory.
